photo.title: Looking through the Arc de Triomf

photo.description: El Arco de Triunfo (oficialmente y en catalán: Arc del Triomf) es un monumento situado en la ciudad de Barcelona, diseñado por el arquitecto Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas como entrada principal a la Exposición Universal de Barcelona de 1888.

photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Walking downhill on Passeig de Sant Joan towards the arc and the expo park behind it visitors are greeted by a frieze known as Barcelona Rep Les Nacions (Barcelona Welcoming the Nations) by the sculptor Josep Reynés i Gurguí, dedicated to the “Support of the Nations for the Universal Competition”. On the left side are these female figures in a choir. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona frieze barcelonareplesnacions sculpture josepreynésigurguí allegory statue 1989 arcdetriomf
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Surrounding the arch stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona statue manuelfuxàileal perecarbonellihuguet lasfamas pheme 1989 arcdetriomf angel
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). The Arc is crowned by the coat of arms of the Spanish monarchy, flanked by two lions supporting the Pillars of Hercules, the ancient name given to the Strait of Gibraltar, and ringed by the Order of the Golden Fleece. Under the lions stands the words Plus Ultra – a motto meaning “Further and Beyond” in Latin. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona sculpture coatofarms lion pillarsofhercules orderofthegoldenfleece anagram motto statue shield 1989 arcdetriomf
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). The right hand side is by Antoni Vilanova i March. This frieze is of the allegories of Industry, Commerce, the Navy and Agriculture. Surrounding the upper part stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona frieze allegory statue 1989 arcdetriomf antonivilanovaimarch manuelfuxàileal perecarbonellihuguet lasfamas pheme angel
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Walking downhill on Passeig de Sant Joan towards the arc and the expo park behind it visitors are greeted by a frieze known as Barcelona Rep Les Nacions (Barcelona Welcoming the Nations) by the sculptor Josep Reynés i Gurguí, dedicated to the “Support of the Nations for the Universal Competition”. In the center of the frieze is an allegorical figure of Barcelona, with the city coat of arms on its chest. It is flanked to the left by Cybele, goddess of the earth, crowned by a tower. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Walking downhill on Passeig de Sant Joan towards the arc and the expo park behind it visitors are greeted by a frieze known as Barcelona Rep Les Nacions (Barcelona Welcoming the Nations) by the sculptor Josep Reynés i Gurguí, dedicated to the “Support of the Nations for the Universal Competition”. In the center of the frieze is an allegorical figure of Barcelona, with the city coat of arms on its chest. It is flanked to the left by Cybele, goddess of the earth, crowned by a tower, and to the right by Pallas Athena with P and F on her shield meaning “Progress” and “Felicity”. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). The right hand side is by Antoni Vilanova i March. This frieze is of the allegories of Industry, Commerce, the Navy and Agriculture. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Walking downhill on Passeig de Sant Joan towards the arc and the expo park behind it visitors are greeted by a frieze known as Barcelona Rep Les Nacions (Barcelona Welcoming the Nations) by the sculptor Josep Reynés i Gurguí, dedicated to the “Support of the Nations for the Universal Competition”. In the center of the frieze is an allegorical figure of Barcelona, with the city coat of arms on its chest. It is flanked to the left by Cybele, goddess of the earth, crowned by a tower, and to the right by Pallas Athena with P and F on her shield meaning “Progress” and “Felicity”. To the right on the frieze is a group of mythological figures and on the left is a are female figures in a choir. The frieze is crowned by the coat of arms of the Spanish monarchy, flanked by two lions supporting the Pillars of Hercules, the ancient name given to the Strait of Gibraltar, and ringed by the Order of the Golden Fleece. Under the lions stands the words Plus Ultra – a motto meaning “Further and Beyond” in Latin. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). The Arc is crowned by the coat of arms of the Spanish monarchy, flanked by two lions supporting the Pillars of Hercules, the ancient name given to the Strait of Gibraltar, and ringed by the Order of the Golden Fleece. Under the lions stands the words Plus Ultra – a motto meaning “Further and Beyond” in Latin. The frieze contains a stone carving entitled El Repartiment de Recompenses als Participants a l’Exposició (The Reward), a work from Josep Llimona i Bruguera representing the awards ceremony for participants in the exhibition. Surrounding the arch stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

In the center of the frieze is an allegorical figure of Barcelona, with the city coat of arms on its chest. photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). The arches are lined on both sides with the shields of 49 the Spanish provinces, half on each side, presided over by the coat of arms of the city of Barcelona. At the ends of the arch you will also find bats, one on each side. The bat was the emblem and lucky charm of [[Jaume I]] (James of Aragon). Under him the city flourished economically. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Relevo de Torquat Tasso. El Arco de Triunfo (oficialmente y en catalán: Arc del Triomf) es un monumento situado en la ciudad de Barcelona, diseñado por el arquitecto Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas como entrada principal a la Exposición Universal de Barcelona de 1888. Está situado entre el paseo Lluís Companys y el paseo de San Juan [1]. La estructura de ladrillo visto, de inspiración neomudéjar, tiene una altura de 30 metros. A diferencia de otros arcos de triunfo de marcado carácter militar, el Arco de Triunfo de Barcelona tiene un mayor carácter civil marcado por el progreso artístico, científico y económico. El Arco de Triunfo ha sido utilizado como meta en alguna ocasión para algunas de las carreras pedestres populares más importantes de Barcelona, como la Jean Bouin o la Maratón de Barcelona. El arco fue restaurado en 1990. Josep Reynés esculpió "Barcelona rep les nacions" ("Barcelona recibe las naciones") en la parte delantera. Josep Llimona esculpió en la parte trasera el reparto de recompensas a los participantes de la exposición. En el lado derecho Antoni Vilanova esculpió alegorías de la Industria, la Agricultura y el Comercio. En el izquierdo Torquat Tasso esculpió alegorías a las Ciencias y las Artes. Manel Fuxà y Pere Carbonell crearon 4 esculturas femeninas para la obra: las Famas.

photo.title: Arc de Triomf, vista completa (Victory Arch, complet view)

photo.description: Construït com a porta d'accés del recinte firal de l'Exposició Universal de Barcelona del 1888 per Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas,d'estil neomudèjar, hi destaquen el fris de la façana principal amb l'escultura "Barcelona rep les nacions" de Josep Reynés; el de la façana posterior (la que mira cap el parc de la Ciutadella) amb l'obra primerenca de Josep Llimona "Recompensa" que representa el lliurament de guardons als participants a l'Exposició (és el que es pot veure a la foto). Construído como puerta de acceso al recinto ferial de la Exposición Universal de Barcelona del 1888 por Josep Vilaseca y Casanovas, de estilo neomudéjar, se distingue el friso de la fachada principal con la escultura "Barcelona recibe las naciones" de Josep Reynés; el de la fachada posterior (la que mira hacia el parque de la ciudadela) con la obra primeriza de Josep Llimona "Recompensa" que representa la entrega de premios a los participantes de la exposición (es el que se ve en la foto). It was built as main entrance to the1888 World Fair of Barcelona by Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas in neomudejar style. In the back frieze we can see the sculpture 'Barcelona welcomes to the nations' by Josep Reynes. In the main frieze (in this pic) we can see the first work of Josep Llimona 'Reward' with the prizegiving of the fair.

photo.title: Arc de Triomf de Barcelona, 1888 (Victory Arch of Barcelona, 1988)

photo.description: Arc de Triomf, Barcelona (Spain). ENGLISH In different points of Barcelona they appear symbols of bats. One knows that until first of the 20th. century, in the coat of the city there was a bat, of way similar to the coats of Valencia and Palma de Mallorca. Because of I have been able to know, this comes from the times of king Jaume I (1208-1276). A legend says that during his reconquers of Valencia, a bat settled over the helmet of the king, interpreting that fact like a warning so that he watched. Also it seems to be that it is an “evolution” of the figure of the dragoon that took some ancient helmets. *** The Arc de Triomf (English: Triumphal Arch) is an archway structure in Barcelona, Spain. It was built for the 1888 Universal exhibition, as its main access gate by architect Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas. The arch is built in reddish brickwork in the Moorish Revival style. The front frieze contains the stone sculpture "Barcelona rep les nacions" (Catalan for "Barcelona welcomes the nations") by Josep Reynés. The opposite frieze contains a stone carving named "Recompense", a work from the earliest period of Josep Llimona. The top of the arch is decorated with the Barcelona coat of arms as well as a representation of all 49 other Spanish provinces, work of Torquat Tassó and Antoni Vilanova. The arch is located between the Passeig de Lluís Companys and the Passeig de Sant Joan, at the end of a wide promenade connecting with the Park of the Ciutadella. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arc_de_Triomf -------------------------- CASTELLANO Para el que no esté muy "suelto" en inglés, el título de la foto es un sencillo juego de palabras que he hecho con "bat", que es "murciélago" en inglés, completándolo con "celona" para confundirlo con "Barcelona". En diferentes puntos de Barcelona aparecen símbolos de murciélagos. Se sabe que hasta primeros del s. XX, en el escudo de la ciudad había un murciélago, de manera similar a los escudos de Valencia y de Palma de Mallorca. Por lo que he podido saber, esto viene de los tiempos del rey Jaume I (1208-1276). Una leyenda dice que durante la reconquista de Valencia, un murciélago se posó sobre la celada del rey, interpretándose ese hecho como un aviso para que vigilara. También parece ser que es una "evolución" de la figura del dragón que llevaban algunos yelmos. *** El Arco de Triunfo es un monumento diseñado por Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas como entrada principal a la Exposición Universal de Barcelona de 1888. La estructura de ladrillo visto de inspiración neomudéjar tiene una altura de 30 metros. Josep Reynés esculpió "Barcelona rep les nacions" ("Barcelona recibe las naciones") en la pante delantera. Josep Llimona esculpió en la parte trasera el reparto de recompensas a los participantes de la exposición. Las esculturas de la parte delantera y trasera costaron cada una 3.270 pesetas de la época. En el lado derecho Antoni Vilanova esculpió alegorías de de la Industria, la Agricultura y el Comercio. En el izquierdo Torquat Tasso esculpió alegorías a las ciencias y las artes. Cada uno de los escultores recibieron 1.530 pesetas por sus trabajos. Manuel Foxà y Pere Carbonell crearon 4 esculturas femeninas para la obra: las famas. En la parte interior del arco pueden verse los escudos de las 49 provincias españolas. A diferencia de otros arcos de triunfo de marcado carácter militar, el Arco de Triunfo de Barcelona tiene un mayor carácter civil marcado por el progreso en artístico, científico y económico. El arco fue restaurado en 1989. Fuente: es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arco_de_Triunfo_de_Barcelona

photo.description: Arc de Triomf, Barcelona (Spain). 'The entrance / La entrada' On White Artizen HDR and Fattal tone mapping over a single JPEG. ENGLISH The Arc de Triomf (English: Triumphal Arch) is an archway structure in Barcelona, Spain. It was built for the 1888 Universal exhibition, as its main access gate by architect Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas. The arch is built in reddish brickwork in the Moorish Revival style. The front frieze contains the stone sculpture "Barcelona rep les nacions" (Catalan for "Barcelona welcomes the nations") by Josep Reynés. The opposite frieze contains a stone carving named "Recompense", a work from the earliest period of Josep Llimona. The top of the arch is decorated with the Barcelona coat of arms as well as a representation of all 49 other Spanish provinces, work of Torquat Tassó and Antoni Vilanova. The arch is located between the Passeig de Lluís Companys and the Passeig de Sant Joan, at the end of a wide promenade connecting with the Park of the Ciutadella. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arc_de_Triomf -------------------------- CASTELLANO El Arco de Triunfo es un monumento diseñado por Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas como entrada principal a la Exposición Universal de Barcelona de 1888. La estructura de ladrillo visto de inspiración neomudéjar tiene una altura de 30 metros. Josep Reynés esculpió "Barcelona rep les nacions" ("Barcelona recibe las naciones") en la pante delantera. Josep Llimona esculpió en la parte trasera el reparto de recompensas a los participantes de la exposición. Las esculturas de la parte delantera y trasera costaron cada una 3.270 pesetas de la época. En el lado derecho Antoni Vilanova esculpió alegorías de de la Industria, la Agricultura y el Comercio. En el izquierdo Torquat Tasso esculpió alegorías a las ciencias y las artes. Cada uno de los escultores recibieron 1.530 pesetas por sus trabajos. Manuel Foxà y Pere Carbonell crearon 4 esculturas femeninas para la obra: las famas. En la parte interior del arco pueden verse los escudos de las 49 provincias españolas. A diferencia de otros arcos de triunfo de marcado carácter militar, el Arco de Triunfo de Barcelona tiene un mayor carácter civil marcado por el progreso en artístico, científico y económico. El arco fue restaurado en 1989. Fuente: es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arco_de_Triunfo_de_Barcelona

photo.description: This beautiful arch was built for the 1888 Universal Exposition, which took place at the Parc de la Ciutadella. The Arc de Triomf, situated at the end of a wide promenade, served as the exposition's main entrance. The design by Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas stands out from other well-known arches - in particular the Arc de Triomphe in Paris - by its colorful brickwork in mudéjar style, a style which has its origins in Moorish architecture. The arch is decorated with stone carvings. The front frieze by Josep Reynés shows the city of Barcelona welcoming visitors. The other side, designed by Josep Llimona shows a prize-giving ceremony. The Arc de Triomf, located at the Passeig Lluis Companys, can be easily reached via the metro stop 'Arc de Triomf'. It is also just a short walk from the Parc de la Ciutadella.

photo.description: Not the one in Paris, this one was built in 1888 in Barcelona for the World's Fair.
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Surrounding the arch stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona statue manuelfuxàileal perecarbonellihuguet lasfamas pheme 1989 arcdetriomf angel

Surrounding the arch stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). This frieze contains a stone carving entitled El Repartiment de Recompenses als Participants a l’Exposició (The Reward), a work from Josep Llimona i Bruguera representing the awards ceremony for participants in the exhibition. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). On the left side Torquat Tasso i Nadal made the allegories of the Sciences and the Arts. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). Surrounding the arch stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). On the left side Torquat Tasso i Nadal made the allegories of the Sciences and the Arts. Surrounding the upper part stands 12 statues by Manuel Fuxà i Leal and Pere Carbonell i Huguet, the 12 are only 4 different female figures called Las Famas (The Fame’s), 2 by each sculptor. Pheme was the goddess or spirit of fame and renown, her favour being notability, depicted with wings and holding either a trumpet, a laurel wreath and/or a palm leaf symbolizing the recovery of Catalan self-respect and its recognition as a nation. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf
photo.tags: matthias mybcn spain catalonia barcelona josepvilasecaicasanovas neomudéjar red brick 1888 exposicióuniversaldebarcelona frieze allegory statue 1989 arcdetriomf manuelfuxàileal perecarbonellihuguet lasfamas pheme angel torquattassoinadal
photo.title: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas designed the emblematic Arc de Triomf in a Neo-Mudéjar style, recognized by the use of glazed red brickwork. This style was developed by the Moors in the 12th century and made for an impressive entrance to the 1888 Exposició Universal de Barcelona (Universal Expo). At the ends of the arch you will also find bats, one on each side. The bat was the emblem and lucky charm of Jaume I (James of Aragon). Under him the city flourished economically. More information can be found on myBCN here: Arc de Triomf

photo.description: The Arc de Triomf is an archway structure in Barcelona, Spain. It was built for the 1888 Universal exhibition, as its main access gate by architect Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas.
